Our Mission

Literacy Doesn't End at Death.

In 1987, a 19-year-old calico named Meredith Whiskers III died on a warm radiator in Trenton, New Jersey. She left behind no will, no heirs, and one unfinished copy of Watership Down that she'd been sitting on for six years. That book was 11 inches tall. She never had a chance.

Today, the DSMV Tiny Tomes Initiative ensures no departed soul ‚Äî feline or otherwise ‚Äî is denied the right to read simply because their translucent paws can't grip a full-sized hardcover. Every book in our collection measures 2 inches or less. Every page is printed on ectoplasm-compatible paper. Every story is purrfect.

We don't know why it smells so good in here. We have investigated. The smell predates us. Please stop asking.

The Great Catsby 1.8"

F. Scatt Fitzgerald ‚ò£ Aroma: Old money & tuna

A ghost cat stares across a bay at a green light that turns out to be a laser pointer. 47 pages. Devastating. Three members of our Thursday group had to be re-deceased.

Gabriel Garc√≠a Meowquez ‚ò£ Aroma: Rain on warm stone

The full text but every human character replaced with a cat who knocks things off tables. Surprisingly, the plot is unchanged. Our most checked-out title since March.

To Kill a Mockingbird (Literally) 1.6"

Harper Leash ‚ò£ Aroma: Southern porch & feathers

A courtroom drama where the defendant is a tabby accused of killing a mockingbird. He did it. Everyone knows he did it. He's not sorry. Acquitted on all charges. 4.9 stars.

The 7 Habits of Highly Effective Ghosts 1.9"

Stephen R. Covey (Deceased) ‚ò£ Aroma: Corporate lavender

Habit 1: Be Proactive (about haunting). Habit 4: Think Win-Win (you scare them, they scream, everyone's happy). Habit 7: Sharpen the Claw. The self-help book that changed the afterlife.

Paws on the Wheel: A History of the DSMV 2.0"

Meredith Whiskers III ‚ò£ Aroma: Bureau filing cabinets

Our founder's memoir. Covers the 1987 founding, the Great Licensing Scandal of '03 (a Siamese was issuing fake IDs), and the ongoing mystery of why the building smells like a French bakery. 212 tiny pages. Required reading for all volunteers.

Why Is Everything So Small: A Pamphlet 0.8"

Anonymous ‚ò£ Aroma: Existential dread & cinnamon

We found this on the floor. It appears to be a complaint. We filed it under Non-Fiction because we cannot disprove its claims. Currently our third most-requested title.

Goodnight, Room I Died In 1.2"

Goodnight radiator. Goodnight window I fell out of. Goodnight the concept of corporeal form. A gentle bedtime story for ghost kittens ages 0-2 (in death years).

If You Give a Ghost a Treat 1.4"

Laura Numeroff-Nine-Lives ‚ò£ Aroma: Phantom treats

If you give a ghost a treat, he'll want a bowl. If you give him a bowl, he'll remember he can't eat. If he remembers he can't eat, he'll knock the bowl off the counter anyway. Instant classic. 6 pages.

The Vacuum Cleaner Owner's Manual 1.7"

Dyson Corp. ‚ò£ Aroma: CLASSIFIED

Banned in 2019 after a reading caused a mass haunting event at a Bed Bath & Beyond in Paramus. Seven ghosts had to be sedated. We do not speak of this.

Emergency Closure: Wing C Flooded with Ectoplasm Again

January 15, 2025 ¬∑ Filed by Reginald Fluffington

Following last Thursday's emotionally charged reading of The Catsby, Wing C experienced what our insurance provider calls a "Class 4 Spectral Moisture Event." Fourteen ghosts wept simultaneously, producing approximately 23 gallons of ectoplasm. The Kitten Lit section sustained significant damage. Goodnight, Room I Died In ‚Äî ironically ‚Äî survived. Kevin has been given a mop and no explanation.

Wing C will reopen once the ectoplasm reaches an acceptable viscosity. We apologize for the inconvenience and the smell, which has somehow gotten better.

Treasurer's Note: Stop Trying to Donate Ectoplasm

December 3, 2024 ¬∑ Filed by Chairman Meow

To our generous supporters: we appreciate your commitment to our cause. However, I must reiterate for the fourteenth time that ectoplasm is not legal tender. Our payment processor (Square) does not accept it. PayPal does not accept it. The IRS does not recognize it as a deductible donation. The jar labeled "Ectoplasm Donations" in the lobby was placed there by an unknown party and has been removed. It was full. We don't know what to do with it.

Please donate in USD. We accept checks, credit cards, and, reluctantly, cryptocurrency. Thank you.

PRESS RELEASE: DSMV Tiny Tomes Wins "Most Fragrant Non-Profit" for Third Consecutive Year

November 18, 2024 ¬∑ Filed by Meredith Whiskers III

The National Council of Spectral Organizations has once again awarded DSMV Tiny Tomes the title of Most Fragrant Non-Profit. We would like to emphasize, as we do every year, that we did not apply for this award. We do not want this award. The smell is not something we cultivate, encourage, or understand. It was here before us. It will be here after us. We are merely its tenants.

That said, we are honored. The trophy is 6 inches tall, which means it cannot be stored in our facility. Kevin is keeping it at his apartment. He thinks he won a podcast award.

Frequently Asked Questions

Before You Haunt Our Inbox

Why are all the books so small? +
Ghost paws experience a 73% reduction in grip strength post-mortem. Standard books are a safety hazard and a dignity issue. Our founder, Meredith Whiskers III, died without finishing a single book because she couldn't turn the pages. Every title in our collection is 2 inches or less, printed on ectoplasm-resistant cardstock with paw-turn page technology. This is not a gimmick. This is accessibility.
Why does it smell so good in here? +
We don't know. We've had four independent investigations. The first concluded "bakery-adjacent aromatics of unknown spectral origin." The second investigator quit. The third said it was "probably ghosts" and charged us $4,200. The fourth investigation is being led by Reginald Fluffington, who has spent three years sniffing corners and filing inconclusive reports. Current leading theories: (1) the building is haunted by a deceased French baker, (2) it's a side effect of concentrated ectoplasm, (3) the Basement Thing. We have stopped asking. It smells like fresh bread and lavender today. It smelled like cinnamon rolls yesterday. Please stop filing Form 9L-SNIFF. We don't have answers.
I'm not a cat. Can I still join? +
Technically, yes. Our charter was amended in 2008 to include "all spectral entities and compatible living organisms." In practice, 94% of our membership is cats. We've had three human members (one is Kevin, who doesn't know he's a member), a hamster ghost who attended one meeting and was never seen again, and Duke the Great Dane, whose application has been "under review" for seven years. We are not discriminatory. We are simply cat-forward.
What's in the basement? +
It has a library card. It checked out Why Is Everything So Small in 2021. It has not returned it. The late fee would be $0.00 because we don't charge late fees, but it's the principle. We've left notes. The notes disappear. Once, a note was returned with the word "NO" written on it in what appeared to be ectoplasm but smelled like rosemary focaccia. We no longer go to the basement. The Basement Thing is classified as "staff" for insurance purposes.
Is this a real DMV? +
Yes. The Department of Spectral Motor Vehicles issues Class S (Spectral) driver's licenses, haunting permits, and ectoplasm disposal certifications. The book club started as a waiting room initiative in 1992 when wait times exceeded 400 spectral minutes. It is now the primary reason most ghosts visit. We still process licenses. The wait is currently 47 minutes. Nobody is waiting. Everyone is reading.
How do I return a book if my paws pass through it now? +
This is a known issue. Approximately 12% of our members experience "phase drift," where their ectoplasmic density fluctuates and they lose the ability to interact with physical objects. If this happens, please visit our front desk and fill out Form 9L-DRIFT. A staff member will retrieve the book from wherever it fell through your paws. If the book fell through the floor into the basement, we will issue a replacement. We do not retrieve items from the basement. See previous question.

Get Involved

Volunteer Oppurrtunities

All positions are unpaid (we're dead, and also a non-profit). Haunting experience preferred but not required.

Tiny Book Binder

Hand-bind miniature books using ectoplasm-resistant thread and spectral-grade adhesive. Must be comfortable working at 2-inch scale. Magnifying glass provided. Previous bookbinding experience or at least 3 functional paws required.

Ghost or Living

Smell Investigator (Junior)

Assist Reginald in the ongoing investigation. Duties include sniffing, documenting sniffs, and filing Form 9L-SNIFF. Must have a functioning nose (spectral or otherwise). No findings expected. This is a long-term commitment.

Ghost Preferred

Kevin's Supervisor

Kevin needs supervision. He's been here 7 months and still thinks this is a podcast studio. Duties include redirecting Kevin, explaining things Kevin won't understand, and making sure Kevin doesn't go to the basement. Must be visible to the living.

Living Only

Ectoplasm Custodian

Post-reading cleanup. Thursday nights are the worst. Must own or be willing to purchase a spectral mop ($34.99, not reimbursable ‚Äî see Chairman Meow's expense policy). Emotional resilience recommended.
